caption: very mean and rude！ don’t go there！
nice place, but some foods are mot good for me
One of my top three Nashville fried chicken joints in LA. Not to mention its halal great chicken amazebals!
Not happy with service.
Great service and delicious food! I will be making the trip back to Sze Chuan Cuisine .
SO GOOD. this place RIPS its amazing.
Everything was so good!! Definitely my new favorite spot.
Very authentic cuisine. We have the fish fillet in chili oil, boiled beef and a couple other small dishes. It's more expensive than some of the other places in Chinatown.
I just enjoyed their dishes. I always get excellent service here. The place is well kept and the workers are always very welcoming. Will visit here again.
Authentic  Szechuan food, good for people who like spicy. but a little pricey.
(Translated by Google) There are many Chinese special products, and the price is favorable!  (Original) 中国特色商品多，价格优惠！

Pretty good mix of authentic Chinese dishes and american styled Chinese dishes. I've had the chance to try out a few of beef and lamb sizzling plates, and they are both quite good, although I wish that they came with moar meats.
Kids loved it. A must try
Less than stellar experience won't be back.

We are still raving about the food! Every dish and appetizer was savory and delicious. I enjoy spicy and hot foods. Sze Chuan Cuisine delivered! If one didn't want theirs too spicy that is available also. The staff are very friendly and timely. My personal favorite was the popcorn chicken with peppercorns and hot chili peppers!!
nice place and good service, can be better on the price.

Amazing authentic Asian cuisine.  No fried chicken wings or boneless ribs here. No fortune cookie at the end of your meal. This is the real deal.  Everything was delicious. I think it's the best wonton soup I ever had.  You can tell everything is made from scratch by how long it takes to come out, how hot it is, and how delicious it tastes  Adding this to my list of places to visit again next time I am in Chicago.
Best spicy noodle soup I've had in the area. The other Szechuan style dishes taste very authentic. Really taste the peppercorns. I also recommend the popcorn chicken, and the spicy fish hotpot.
really bad service...

(Translated by Google) The service is really rubbish. If you finish the dishes, you don't pour the water. You don't want to give the meal paper. Pack it yourself. In addition to serving the dishes, you can say that there is no service. Run out to force the tip to really serve, encounter such a tip that is not recommended to them, give one or two knives to let them serve the face.  (Original) 服务真的垃圾，点完菜没给倒水，要餐纸没人给，打包自己来，除了端菜上来，可以说是没服务。跑出来强迫要小费真的服、遇到这种坚决不给他们推荐的小费，给一两刀让他们端个菜都是给面子了

(Translated by Google) The dish is good, the waiter's attitude can only be described with nausea. How do your family's waiters come to ask for a 15% tip? Which rule says that the disgusting service has to give you a 15% tip.  (Original) 菜不错，服务员态度呢只能用恶心来形容，你们家的服务员是怎么好意思过来要15%的小费的？哪条规定说多恶心的服务都得给你15%小费了

(Translated by Google) We recommended in the Chicago squad that this restaurant chose the buffet hot pot. The most incomprehensible thing is that the lamb they gave me was left by other guests. We recommend this in the Chicago squad. This restaurant chose the hot pot. The most incomprehensible thing is that the lamb they gave me is the rest of the guests. The most incomprehensible thing is that the lamb they gave me is the rest of the guests.
Awesome food. One of my favorites to visit in Chicago, and completely worth it if you like spicy food.

‏it was worse restaurant experience.  if you want to choke on the food and cry entire time visit this restaurant!  it cost you only 30 box but you can experience out of this world customer service they don't let you even to keep the menu (( restaurant policy # communist Chinese restaurant rules))  all the meats are frozen vegetable are super old and pot is leftover deep fried oil and pepper mix with I don't know what kind of water!!! من مادر آشپزخانه گ*****
Amazing food

(Translated by Google) A shop that I was very fond of, but I feel that the quality of the dishes has dropped significantly. The plate, the dish, and the taste are all changing. What I can't stand most is that the restaurant staff has been talking about anti-dang speech. He has his freedom of speech, and he has not had any influence on the things that have been bad in the period of the Anti-Japanese War. Instead, the country is developing so rapidly that we can go outside to understand the world. The National Day has just ended. Everyone is grateful to the country and happy about the achievements of our country. These people, even their own countries do not love, I do not know why they can be determined. The news that said that HK is making trouble there is also clapping with other staff members. I really can't stand it!  (Original) 本來非常鍾愛的一家店，但是感覺菜品質量明顯下降了許多。擺盤，菜色，口味都有變化。 最讓我受不了的是餐廳工作人員一直在講反dang言論。他有他的言論自由，講那些抗戰時期的事情再多不好的地方也沒對他產生一點影響。反而現在國家發展的這麼迅速我們才可能走到外面來了解這個世界。國慶剛剛結束，大家都是對國家心懷感恩，開心我們國家的成就。偏偏這些人，連自己的國家都不愛，不知他們能為甚麼事情而堅定。在那邊說HK鬧事的新聞還和其他工作人員一同拍手稱快，我真的很受不了！
Oustanding in China Town Chicago
The most delicious Szechuan food in Chinatown, and I’ve tried them all! If you’re looking for that mouth-numbing Szechuan peppercorn experience, you’ve found the right place!

The food was very good! Spicy af just like how I want it. I think the price is a little bit pricy for its food and quality, regardless it was still a very pleasant experience. I would definitely go back there again. Although my original desire was to go there for some Szechuan crawfish but unfortunately they ran out of crawfish :( so that was kinda sad. The staffs were very friendly to me. They even offered to take a picture for our group!

Ordered online through their website, they called me to ask how I ordered/who I paid (!) obviously unfamiliar with the SlickMenus system on their own website. Kept me on the phone for 10+ minutes. In the end I said I would just cancel, since they obviously did not want to fulfill my order. These days I think it’s important to have a working method of online ordering, sometimes it is difficult to understand people on the phone/what if you’re in a meeting at work etc. Anyway I ordered from a different Sichuan restaurant (JMC on Cermak, higher ranked too) and it was delicious . Can’t speak for the food at this place, but not a streamlined experience in the least.
Their hotpot was killer.  Good service and decently priced.

Horrible service. Lamb was terrible full of bones and barely any meat. Mandatory 18% tip on the bill. Very provoking.  Bad service and no smile ever. Could not understand the waitress. Bad all the way. Stay away

I’m not one to rate bad reviews, but if I had the option of giving 0 stars, I would. I asked a simple question about how the chicken was cooked, and the manager, yes the manager went OFF on me. I felt attacked for sure. I’m disgusted, frustrated, and annoyed. This place deserves no business just based off their customer service. It’s absolutely insane. I’m honestly shocked at how we were treated.
Ribs are legendary, and nothing was short of fantastic. Can't recommend enough.

Really underrated place. Came on a Wednesday around Lunchtime/Noon and not many people came. This place definitely deserves more for what it looks. Great decor, low light vibe.  Staff is extremely friendly and allowed me to take more photos of the restaurant, including the upstairs area with more seating. It really is pretty there. They attend often and refills water the moment they see it low. It's a nice experience.  Menu definitely felt looked like it could use more options, but it has enough non-spicy options in the first place. It's Sze Chuan food so you should expect to eat spicy.  Food had a good enough portion for the average person. I don't usually eat spicy food or at all. However, this place has small enough portions to not overwhelm you with spicy food.  I felt like the Mapo Tofu should be served in a circular dish/bowl with the rice. The square dishes make it a bit difficult to scoop up the food. The Spicy Garlic Pork with Rice was a tasty dish that isn't too spicy for people who can't eat spicy foods.  Definitely recommend the Spicy Garlic Pork with Rice. Wednesday Lunch was a low volume of people if you want to eat with less people around. Staff extremely friendly and welcoming. Definitely going to come more often
Amazing fresh food. I ordered the garlic greens. They were cooked to perfection. Skip the kung pap and go straight for the chili popcorn chicken. The lamb extra spicy is also a huge winner.
Great food and portions, including good vegetarian options for people like me!
Very authentic Chinese
Good, very, very spicy
Waitress was very kind and answered our questions. The food was delicious. We also had some wine. The food came out quickly and was flavorful. So many food options!
Delicious!

Food there is definitely good. But man, this place has the worst service ever. I was making a reservation on the phone a few days ago. The waiter on the line was so impatient that he would not like to help me out. I was asking for a seafood course and I knew they have it. After he could not find it, he hung up on me.  They definitely need to train their employees better. But I am surely not going there anymore.
(Translated by Google) It’s not an American Chinese meal with chili.  (Original) 不是加了辣椒的美式中餐就叫川菜
Very delicious Sichuan food
Highly recommended! !!
Best spot in Chinatown hands down. We had the Salt and Pepper Shrimp, Pork Fried Rice, a sauteed beef dish, and dumplings and all were delicious.

(Translated by Google) Very Good! We tried the dumplings, sesame chicken, pot stickers and steamed pork feet! Best was for stickers "gyoza" and the sesame chicken.  (Original) Muito boa! Experimentamos os dumplings, sesame chicken, pot stickers e steamed pork feet! Melhor foi por stickers "gyoza" e o sesame chicken.

(Translated by Google) I don't know what the big brother in front of us is crazy about today. You can understand when you are in a hurry. You have to pack the box for a long time. When you call the waiter several times, you are busy sweeping the clothes and rushing to work. We don’t want to give you a tip. It is. The big brother at the front desk still has to shamelessly ask for a 15% tip. Can you tell me this is a black shop? Your dirty clothes and greasy face are worth 15% of your tip. ?  (Original) 不知道今天前面领位的那位大哥发什么疯，你着急下班都可以理解，要打包盒拿半天，喊了几次服务员买单都忙着扫地穿衣服急着下班，我们已经不想给你们好小费了。前台那大哥还恬不知耻的要求必须给15%的小费。请问你这是黑店吗？你那一身脏了吧唧的衣服和油腻腻的脸你值15%的小费 吗？

(Translated by Google) The service attitude is particularly bad, forcing the guests to tip. This is the first time I have heard in the United States for 30 years that I have to give a 15% tip. I will not go again. I think this place is delicious. It is useless. ......  (Original) 服务态度特别差 强迫客人给小费 这是我在美国三十年第一次听说过一定要给15%的小费 我不会再去了 让我觉得这个地方东西就是在好吃都是没有用的……
The food was pretty good! It came out  quickly and each platter could feed about two people. The only problem was that the atmosphere didn't exactly feel welcoming and our waitress was a bit rude.
Yummy yummy in my tummy.
I love their mapo tofu and many more dishes! Very authentic food!
Everything we try was delicious

No doubt the food is amazing. If you are looking for authentic food then this is the place.  The reason I gave 3 star is because of service and billing. The total bill was 90$ and I gave 103$ with tips. The receptionist was very unwelcoming and asked for exact 15% tip which comes around 103 $ and some change. He said that 15% is min and I have to pay for it even if it’s a difference of few cents. I said no and walked out.  They just lost a customer and few of my friends. Never seen a place asking exact 15% tip
(Translated by Google) Disgusting and rude! Shameless fly house  (Original) disgusting and rude！ 不要脸的苍蝇馆子
Yummy yummy yummy! Best Chinese in Chicago
Ok
Their food is good!  And their prices too!
If you like spicy, come here.
Food was good not the best Chinese I have had

(Translated by Google) "There is nothing to say, poor! 》  I went to eat and eat for the first time and said that I never went again. Later I remembered it wrong. I thought that the other car I went to before stopped parking and bought the parking ticket. I just managed to go in, just like everyone said, most The key is that the service is extremely poor. We ordered a piece of meat. It was actually cool, and the middle was still ice. It was obviously the hot end of the microwave oven in the finished dish. The meat 哎~ should be steamed. Taking the heat, my wife called the waiter twice, but my wife got angry and went straight in to find someone. The waiter was full of mouthfuls, and even eating and talking was unfavorable. I panicked and ran out. We just said The dish was cold. She said to go to the kitchen. Later, we waited for a long time to finish eating. They came up halfway, and we were anxious. It is reasonable to say that it should be replaced, isn't it? (Because we didn't touch the one that I had pinched before, I left it on another empty plate.) This time we called the boss and the manager directly. It is apologizing and sorry, but there is no point, then we have to say that We don't want to, let's go, this should be reasonable! Later, they said that you should not change it for you. If you are honest, you will be full of gas. You will not have any mood to eat. Later, the order will be more mad, and you will be charged 18% of the service fee directly on the list. Where is the face?) My wife called the boss directly, saying that you should give me a tip directly, we will give it, but you have just served this service, and it is that we are in a bad mood, and we will not give it. To give you so much, the boss asked the waiter to erase the tip, (we still think about giving less, we never have to give tips, we have 10%-20%), but this time we directly told her that we I don’t give it, listen to me (because it makes us angry again, when we haven’t said not to say less, the waiter starts to collect the tableware and give it to my wife, saying: You can’t give Tips, but I want to tell you that we have no salary to take a tip, it has been repeated many times, but also a particularly stinky face and tableware jingle, she is mean that there is no credit and hard work, this time my wife Heart softly ask her that you Why do you directly give us an 18% tip? She actually said that she was charged by five people. I...............! Three adults, one child of three years old, one baby of six months. (sleeping in the baby basket) So we didn’t talk after listening, we packed up and left...  Oh~ I am so angry! One of the most junk restaurants in Chicago.  (Original) 《无话可说的经历，差！》 第一次去吃 吃完说过再也不去了，后来记错了，以为之前去的另一家，车都停好买了停车票，就勉强进去了，就像大家说的 菜一般，最关键是 服务极差，我们点了一个扣肉，上来居然是凉的，中间还是冰的，明显是成品盘里一摆 微波炉加热端上来的，扣肉哎～应该是蒸出来的，按道理得冒着热气，我老婆叫了两次服务员没人理，后来我老婆生气了直接进去找人，服务员竟然满嘴是饭，正吃的连说话都不利索，慌里慌张跑出来，我们刚说了菜是凉的，她说去跟厨房说，后来我们等了好久都快吃完了，他们端着半份上来了，我们就急了，按理说应该换新的，不是么？（因为我们之前夹出来的一口没碰，全让我丢在另外一个空盘子里）这次我们直接叫了老板 老板娘 和经理，倒是句句道歉和对不起，可是没点说法，那我们只好说那我们不要了，端走吧，这应该合理！后来他们说你们要不要在点别的 给你们换，说实话 气都气饱了，一点心情吃都没有，后来上单更气，直接在单子上给我们加了18%的服务费，（你们哪来的脸要的？）我老婆直接叫了老板，说你们凭什么直接给我加上小费，我们会给但是就你们刚才这服务，还有就是弄错 我们心情很差，给也不会给你们那么多，老板让服务员抹掉了小费，（我们还想着少给点，我们吃饭从来没有不给小费过，10%-20%多少都有）可这次我们直接跟她说我们一分都不给，听我说（是因为又一次让我们火大，在我们还没说不给只说少给的时候，服务员就开始边收餐具边给我老婆叨叨，说：你们可以不给小费，但是我要告诉你们我们是没工资拿小费的，就一直重复了好多次，还特别臭脸 而且餐具叮当乱响，在她叨叨着 意思就是没功劳还有苦劳呢，这时候我老婆心软问她那你说吧，你们凭什么直接给我们就天加了18%的小费？她居然说按五个人头收的，我……………！三个大人，三岁小朋友一枚，六个月婴儿一枚（在婴儿筐里睡着）所以我们听完就 没在说话了，收拾走人… 哎～ 好气！ Chicago 最垃圾的餐馆 没有之一。
Spicy! Delish
Absolutely phenomenal food!
The BEST in China Town!! The Fatty Beef with Three peppers, oh my gods...just divine.
So good!  And the service was excellent!  Such intense but light spicy.
This is one of the best meals I've ever had. Hands down the best Chinese food. The food was spicy without losing flavor. Will definitely be visiting every time I come to the city

This is the most amazing Chinese food I've ever had in the US! After living in China, I never thought I'd again experience the delicious cuisine that I so desperately missed. Now I know that I can get a completely authentic experience with amazing food not too far from home! We loved the MaPo tofu, the wonton soup appetizer and the Chongqing Popcorn chicken.  Can't wait to visit again!
One of the best place to have Sze Chuan food at Chinatown
Every dish we ordered from braised lamb chops to kung pao chicken was all very delicious.

It seems like the only reason this place gets any low reviews is because of the service (which is not bad, but definitely not typical American style).  The food here is excellent.  I live across the city, but still make the half-hour trip to this restaurant every couple of months.  I strongly recommend the La Zi Ji: a spicy, crispy chicken dish.

(Translated by Google) I have been eating here for two consecutive days. The Sichuan cuisine in this shop is very authentic, so I gave the dishes four stars here. I want to eat Sichuan food friends. Strongly push the Sichuan cuisine here, referring to the dish with pepper! Yesterday I ordered a pot of organic cauliflower is really not recommended... the taste and look are very strange!  (Original) 已经连续两天来这里吃饭，这家店的川菜很正宗，所以我给了这里的菜四颗星，想吃川菜胖友可以选择这里！强推这里的川菜，指的是带辣椒的菜噢！昨天点了个一品有机菜花是真的不推荐…味道和样子都很奇怪！
I loved the food!!!
Amazing food. Difficult to navigate menu. Be aware of gratiuity included in bill.
Always tasty, and food comes out super fast. Try the whole fish! Spicy and delicious.
Diarrhea after eating the toasted fish.

Walking through Chinatown we just stumbled into this place, and I'm sure glad we did! Their menu has plenty of choices that are for the more adventurous. Everything we ordered was really delicious, cheap and came out very quickly. The soups are giant so please ask, definitely not a single serving. Unlike other reviewers, our server was super friendly and attentive. The Kung Pow chicken had a really delicious sweetness that I had not had before and thankfully I had enough for leftovers. I will definitely will be coming back here

(Translated by Google) Now there is no chef. There is no salt tofu in the salt and pepper tofu. It tastes like a chewing wax. The beef in the fat beef is less than ten pieces. It is called boiled tofu. If you can't do it, don't do it. Chicago does not lack the Sichuan restaurant. Tofu is taken to feed the dog. The result is that my dog ​​does not eat. Congratulations, you got my first bad review.  (Original) 现在没厨师了吗 椒盐豆腐里根本没放盐 豆腐吃起来如同嚼蜡 豆花肥牛里的牛肉一共不到十片 叫水煮豆腐好了 不能干就别干了芝加哥不缺川菜馆 哦对了 椒盐豆腐拿去喂狗了 结果我家狗都不吃 恭喜你拿到了我的第一个差评
The mapo tofu I had was quite great.
Massive quantities. Not too spicy. A lot of choices. Yummy!!
Awesome place for traditional Sze Chuan food!! Get the dry pepper chicken.
The food was great, staff was very helpful. Must try
Love the ma la spicy to all there food. Popcorn chicken was over fried and chewy. Everything else is sublime.
good taste, good service, will recommend to friends

Food is amazing! Prices very reasonable, Restaurant decor equally awesome. BUT, like many reviews I have read I will agree, the servers are underqualifing. We had a little water spill on our table and what I am about to say is no exaggeration and I had NEVER experience this anywhere, the whole time we where there that water was not cleaned, waitress came over and she saw the spill and literally had no idea what to do, she just brought a couple of thin napkins and tried to cleaned it with that and that’s it, there was still water on our table but she didn’t come back with a rag (which would have been logical in the first place).  Actually after our food came they never came back, we had to get up and hand them the credit card after we were done. They forgot our drinks too. They really need to step up and get better servers. I hope they realized the bad service really affects their tip and that certain people wouldn’t be back because of service. I’ll be back... for the food.
Amazing lamb
Food was really good, but the service was non existent. Mapo Tofu, spring rolls, green beans, sesame chicken, General Tsos, Egg Drop soup were all fantastic. Potstickers were way too doughy.
Genuine Sze Chaun (Sichuan) cuisine with chef from Sze Chuan.
The food was awesome and we weren't rushed.
Authentic Chinese cuisine. Love the atmosphere.

(Translated by Google) good to eat! Spicy enough and numb. But I think the rice is a bit hard. The location is a bit remote, unless you drive to eat directly, it will take a long time to walk from other places in Chinatown.  (Original) 好吃！夠辣夠麻。不過我覺得飯有點硬。 位置有點偏僻，除非開車直接來吃飯，不然從chinatown其他地方走過來要好久。
Nice food and good service.
Great spice! Some of the best tofu dishes I have ever had.
Wow. Big portions, little prices! Everything we had was cooked perfectly! Great taste,  fast service.  The popcorn chicken (yes, I said it) will leave you coming back!
(Translated by Google) Old customers, the current service is really bad, boss, can you seriously find some waiters? ? ?  (Original) 老客户了，现在的服务真的是差到不行，老板你能认真找些服务员来吗？？？
Good choice for Szechwan cuisine.
Menu is intimidating and a bit pricey. Servers are not overly friendly. Menu items come a la cart (no rice). But the food is great. Very fresh and authentic. We got street parking right in front.
They have some authentic dishes but food is overall just okay. They have a decent lunch special on weekdays

Our server Fuwuyuan was extremely rude. She never came to check on our service once the food was done. We had to get up ourself to ask her for more beverages. We didn’t feel welcomed and the overall experience was just uncomfortable.
Nice place. Traditional Chinese. Amazing mushroom salad. Perfectly done. Large portions for sharing.
Great tasting, authentic food from the szechuan region. Expensive plates, but worth the cost.
Rude staff. Dirty walls- dirty carpet. NOT a 🌟

Awful service. We arrived a bit after 9 and they close at 11. The hostess asked if we could order quickly since they closed as soon. Usually, my policy is to leave and never return if a closing time is announced to me as I enter an establishment. However, her tone was much better than a gaggle of waitresses in a greasy spoon in Indiana screaming the closing time at anyone who attempts to eat dinner any later than three hours prior to dinnertime. We gave the place a chance despite this ill warning. The service was hellish. Our food arrived quickly but there was no rice. We struggled to catch our server's eye as she would hurry past, averting her gaze. We finally flagged someone down, who informed us the rice was included and gave us rice still on her tray after serving another table (where I think she had taken five or six bowls left off by the same server). We consumed our food and spent half an hour trying to flag down our server to get our check and request boxes. We were grudgingly given containers, short one lid. The cold noodles and spring roll were ok. The mapo tofu was ok, as was the Chinese greens and mushroom dish. We would have ordered more drinks and dessert had we been acknowledged, but maybe they aren't in this to sell . . . food.  establishment needs to ask if bad service should continue to be it's hallmark given the number of establishments with stellar food and service within a block or two. Choose wisely, and let me know if you want to spoon up the spilled leftovers from my floorboard.
Loved the food!
The service was a little spotty at first but improved once our waitress finally came.  Everything we ordered was delicious.

Food amazing, service not quite up to the same standard (a couple of the servers were arguing in front of customers). Shared three main dishes and a couple of sides between three of us (dudes who can eat), and didn't finish, so the portions were generous. Mongolian Chicken was the one we had least expectations for, and it was unreal. Highly recommended dish.

Watched Anthony Bourdain's Chicago episode and knew I had to go try this place out! When I go to Chinatown I typically go to the Ming Hin side and never explored the busy Chinatown strip. The mapo tofu (the dish Anthony tried) was good but I enjoyed the boiling fish filet more. The cold noodles was good too. Overall, it was amazing sze chuan food! I'd come back again.
Some of the best Asian food I've ever had. Phenomenal flavors. The ma po tofu is great.

I ordered from their website and went to pick up my food and they told me it wasnt their website yet somehow they had my order ? So the guys telling me its the wrong website that has their address, their phone number, their menu, and they got my order so how could it possibly not be their website. Then i had to wait there 30 mins on top of the 20 mins it took me to get there so almost 1 hour for a pick up.

The menu had changed recently and many items were just whited out. The server was    initially friendly and took our order for a group of 5. It went downhill from there. We ordered appetizers first. Some arrived, some did not. Our server disappeared. We had to ask 3 times for the last 3 appetizers. They finally arrived and we then ordered main entrees. Our hot sour soup appeared to be a combination of 2 different soups and was served without bowls & spoons, otherwise the appetizers were all very good. The server appeared with the check after 20 minutes. We told her we had not received our entrees and she seemed confused. Our entrees arrived one by one. The food was very good. The service was very poor. We had really enjoyed this place before but now probably will not go back.
The restaurant does not show that they have charged tips so that you will overpay them. Terrible practice!

Went on a Sunday at 1 pm with 3 people. We were immediately seated and enjoyed some nice warm tea. One of Chinatown's little joys for me is that many places serve tea before a meal. We decided to share everything we ordered which honestly was such a fantastic idea and seems to be the way most Chinese people eat their meals. My friend had been there before so she suggested the Green Beans. These are so flavorful and seasoned well they don't taste like any green beans I have ever tasted. They were clearly roasted or grilled somehow which allowed them to be crunchy yet well cooked. My Bf who does not eat veggies even went to town on these and swore he would be back for more. We had the popcorn chicken that was crunchy yet peppery but not spicy with some green and red peppers with onion. Everything again was well seasoned and really addictive. The house fried rice was meh- wasnt bad wasnt good. They put too much egg in. The house fried noodles with beef was amazing and really had this savory yet kinda salty flavor i have been hankering for. The noodles were slightly chewy for a excellent mouth feel. We had the pork pot stickers- super juicy on the inside yet nice and plump  dumpling on the outside.  We will be back for more food and next time we will be bringing more people with us.  Pro's-Food is amazing, ambience and decor was spot on and all the food was delivered quickly.  Cons-Our waiter was unknowingly ignoring our part of the restaurant- he seemed either too busy or just in a daze. Either way this didnt ruin the experience and I would still come back just for the food. Parking is almost nonexistent but we found a spot.
It has good food

(Translated by Google) The two ordered an egg soup. Boiled beef. Chongqing spicy chicken suggested that the meat of the boiled beef be cut thicker, too thin, and the meat is broken. Egg soup and spicy chicken are really amazing The waiter probably told us that because we were Chinese, I took the box when packing and put it on my table and the person left.😂😂  (Original) 好吃好吃😋两人点了一份蛋汤 水煮牛肉 重庆辣子鸡建议把水煮牛肉的肉切厚一些 太薄了 肉都碎开了 蛋汤跟辣子鸡真的是超赞呐 服务员大概因为我们是中国人所以跟她说打包的时候拿了盒子放我桌子上人就走了😂😂

(Translated by Google) The restaurant is clean and very well kept. Yep be careful with the food since it can be very spicy; however, it is still very good. Recommended  (Original) El restaurante es limpio y muy cuidado. Sip tengan cuidado con la comida ya que puede ser muy picante; sin embargo, no deja de ser muy buena. Recomendado

Horrible service. Incredibly slow, and understaffed. My partner and I waited for over an hour before leaving. I wouldn’t bother coming here — plenty of Sze Chuan places around. This is just unacceptable.
Spicy!!

I used to come to this restaurant at least once a week when I lived in the city. The food is still good but the service has gone down pretty bad. I don't know if its still worth the walk to the end of old Chinatown.  There are just so many other good places closer to the main square.
Love the food
Best Chinese restaurants in Chicago
Dinner with wife was memorable one!

Amazing Szechuan. Huge portions. Bigger tastes. Our table of 3 ordered a lamb, a chicken, and a pork plate to share family style and we ended up with to-go containers for half of it. Every single dish we had was completely unique from the others and each was flawlessly delicious. I found myself picking favorites by the occasion rather than the food itself. Each was so good but so unique that I couldn't pick an outright favorite. Instead, I started inventing scenarios for each to get top billing. Can't wait to go back to try more.  Added bonus for the mounds of Chilis that came with the Chongqing Popcorn Chicken: took them home and started throwing them in everything we cooked. I'm obsessed with them now.
Nice sized shrimp
Service is below average. Food is fine with strong flavors.
Some food great, other food not so great, customer service poor
it's good but not of the traditional as in China
Best with a group so you can get a variety of appetizers and main dishes...
Great. Different and possibly better than Lao Sze Chuan.  Certainly more comfortable.   Helpful to have Chinese speaking friends.
Horrible food. Food is Floating in oil. Terrible service Don’t waste your money. Most unfriendly service I ever had!
One of my most visited chinese restaurants in chinatown. The food is authentic and fresh. The service can be slow during busy hours.
they raised priced by a lot. menu prices did not match check and they refused to honor menu price. Never came to ask whether we need anything. Really bad service.
Good spicy food.
good food
username: Hammett Clinic of Chiropractic Kenosha Chiropractor

caption: The food was good. Cant say it wasn't, that would be a lie. I Wasn't happy that  our orders came out one at a time. We had 5 people. Had to ask for napkins, water a few times. Never came to ask us if we needed anything or if food was good. Had to wave them over to come help. Over all food was good.

The service didn't speak English. We asked several times for water... There was 5 of us and they brought our main dishes out one at a time. By the time all the dishes were served the 1st one was cold... My girls... The food had allot of flavor... Their spices were very unique.. I would say more authentic than your neighborhood Chinese restaurant.. But you may want to polish up on your Chinese..
Good food and nice ambiance.
(Translated by Google) Sichuan food that tastes good  (Original) 味道不错的川菜

Early dinner at Sze Chuan restaurant. Clean venue with nice cozy decoration. We order three dishes. They were delicious, even though two of them were spicy (ribs and mapo tofu) they were not too hot. The ribs were crispy and crunchy, with lots of flavors that makes you wonder.  Many layers of flavors that create a wonderful experience. highly recommendes if you like spicy food. the service was okay, they can improve being a little bit more welcoming.
Really enjoyed the soy pork dish and dumplings, but the popcorn chicken was too salty for me.
(Translated by Google) Authentic Sichuan cuisine  (Original) 地道川菜
Very slow and okay food

The food is not bad. The servers are inexperienced and entitled. I didn't expect good service from small restaurants in Chinatown but this place went below my expectation. They shocked me by charging us 18% service fee for a group of 4 which is not normal in any restaurant I've been to. When asked why, the host said we were sitting at a round table. I asked him if it's written anywhere on the menu or have a sign that mentions this rule and the host just shrugged and looked at us blindly waiting for us to just leave him alone. I normally give about 20% so I've saved 2% but it just doesn't sit well with me.

Their food is awesome! Egg drop soup I have never seen in such big bowl and very tasty. Very good size Chuan. One of the best in Chicago. I wish the server quality is much better. Other than that food is great!
food so good
bad service... really good food
I love it

I normally don't eat sichuan food, so I was excited to visit with family a while back. Sadly, we were disappointed with food that was inedibly salty & the oldest (most fiberous) pea pod tips I've ever had. The only passable dish we had was the dandan mian & the service was OK, but will definitely not visit again.
Authentic Sze Chuan spice
Delicious Chinese food unlike I've ever had.
Delicious! Will return
Great authentic chinese food with common American flavors/styles as well.
Very tasty and good sized portions

I have search for a restaurant as authentic and as delicious as this one but nothing compares. Absolutely love the si ji du, and the spicy popcorn chicken, also the fish in red pepper broth (I can't remember the exact name of the dish). I am so happy I was introduce to this restaurant.

Damn good. I was looking for some off the beaten path authentic good Chinese food. This place was awesome and I will be back next time I am in Chicago.  The dumplings, noodles and pork bun appetizers were amazing.
Beautiful restaurant and amazing food. However the bathrooms are really dirty.
Beautiful setting, great food...  Many dishes I have only found there - for example the woodear dry pot and salad are delightful...
Just downright fantastic! Perfectly executed Szechuan food in a clean Chinatown environment.
I ordered the Mapo Doufu and it was out promptly and very tasty. It was not Chengdu hot but it had a nice balance of spicy and numbing that I was looking for.
Amazing Chinese food!! Appetizers were fantastic and general tao's chicken flavor was great

Wow!  An unexpectedly wonderful meal.  The ma po tofu shouldn't be missed

Good spicy Sichuan. We never take enough people to enjoy all the food, with family-style service and large portions per dish.
Damn this was some tasty food.  No complaints whatsoever.  Go get your eat on!
Our friend said it was great and we had to try it so we went. It was good, but not exactly the greatest sze chuan cuisine.
Amazing. A must if you are in town.

Great Chinese food all around, even the generic Chinese dishes like fried rice are well made. Very modern and polished interior.
We recently discovered the Sze Chuan Cuisine restaurant.  Great Sze Chuan food.  Authentic and nice and spicy!!
Great food. Moderate service. Reasonable prices.

Really good food. I would suggest the popcorn chicken, it's a bit spicy and crunchy.

You know it's authentic when it's full of Chinese people in the restaurant! I rarely venture from Chinatown square and am so happy we did. This is a newer establishment with a very nice modern interior and they brought out the dishes as they were ready. The food tasted very authentic and delicious - perfect for lunch or dinner! Big plus if you can speak Chinese to order.
Food is good but poor service...
Good spicy Chinese food but not great. 4 starts for the excellent service staff and hot tea right when you sit down.

Alot of money for a tiny tostada but it was authentic enough with mexican cheese.  The Chicken was pretty tasty, and even had white meat.  It had a sprinkling of lettuce and it was 95 cents more for a tiny dollap of Guacamole.  The Chips were burnt tasting....can you pleeeeze change the oil?  Burnt oil is toxic and bad to fry things in, I think it is best used for Bio-diesel. Doubt i will go back...to many other places to try!
Spicy food , no one speaks english even the menu Our food came with a fly on it

We had such a positive experience here. The portions are massive, so get a dish to share! The food was incredible, the service was great, and the tea that came with the meal was delicious. I highly recommend the pot stickers and spring rolls.

The food was all magical. Including and especially the peppers that numb your tongue a little bit. Oh it hurts so good. The Ma Po was the best I've had and the fish comes out steaming and bubbling and tasty as you've ever had.

clean
get the duck.  it's awesome

Great, authentic Sichuan food. We always try to come here when we can. Service is not that great, servers won't come to your table unless you wave them over, but they are very nice. Tried delivery once, took them more than 2 hours to deliver, and food went cold and soggy. Try to eat in restaurant instead of delivery.
Delicious food, but it gave me violent diarrhea

Don't come to this restaurant. I'm so disappointed with this restaurant, we came in fourty minutes ago and ordered our dishes, one of us needs to go to class soon but there's no waiter would give us some explaination about why it takes so long!! The table who came later than us got dishes earlier than us. This is unacceptable! I never had this sort of experience in any restaurant I ever been in. Never come back!

indeed ass burning.
The featured dishes (especially spicy ones) are good, but much of the rest of the menu tastes bland.
Awesome, authentic szechuan style food. Never disappoints. And very reasonably priced.
Excellent food if you like spicy!

Inviting atmosphere.. staff was helpful. We ordered the hot sour soup which was very good and a huge portion. We also ordered the walnut shrimp and it was huge shrimp with lots of flavor. I would recommend this place
(Translated by Google) Nice sze Chuan food!!!  (Original) Nice sze Chuan food!!!
Yes this could be  the best Sczhewan restaurant in Chicago.
What an experience! Staff is always with you. Super service. As vegetarian I am amassed by the food quality and taste. Traditional and excellent. All I was hoping for.

Best sze chuan restaurant in Chinatown hands down! Their seafood is top notch too. I definitely recommend the dumplings in chili oil as an appetizer. They have spicy and non-spicy options (best shrimp and walnut dish I've ever had). Honestly, my go-to restaurant for the weekend if I'm craving authentic Chinese.

Went there last night, both outside and inside looked very modern and exotic, the food are authentic szechuan cuisine, if you like spicy and want to try some authentic scechuan cuisine, you may love this place

The outside looked very modern and inviting. The inside decor also looked great, with chandeliers and nice wallpaper. There's an upstairs too so this place must be huge, but on the main floor, the tables and chairs are so close to each other, you would have think this place was cramped. Guests were having difficulty leaving because chairs were in the way. And most importantly, the service here is absolutely horrible.  When we walked in, the hostess was talking to a table of guests like they were her friends. She saw us, lead us to our table, dropped the menu and walked back to her friends - without a single word to us. We waited for someone to come by to see how we were doing, or to offer us water, but no one came. Servers came to clean the tables around us, but they left us waiting even though we kept looking at them. Finally, we got up and left, which is a shame too because I would have loved to try a bunch of things on their menu. Unless they change their staff, I don't see this place sticking around for long and I might never get to try the food.
Walked in. Sat down. Waited.... Waited... Waited... No water, no tea. It seems other tables had trouble getting attention also. Got up and walked out.
